content:
Manage Insurance Policies

Starting with the Winter '20 release, we've created a read-only Policy page built using Salesforce Lightning web component technology. Insurance uses custom Lightning web components to display information stored in the Policy (Asset) object.

The Policy UI runs attribute rules and attribute value rules, then shows any of the following information that's available for any given policy.

POLICY UI TAB

Details
Root insurance product
Total Premium
Total taxes and fees

Coverages
Coverages on the root insurance product
Premiums and attributes for the root insurance product coverages
Premiums and coverages for each insured item
Taxes and fees on the premiums for each insured item
Premium and attributes for each insured item coverage

Insured Items
Insured items
Grandchild insured parties or insured items on each parent insured item
The primary grandchild insured party or insured item is marked with an asterisk (*)
Attribute categories and attributes of each grandchild insured party or insured item

Commercial	
View and manage multi-level commercial policies

Insurance Policy Transactions

Real-time Price Rerating

Manage Insurance Policies

Action Lightning Web Component

Manage Insurance Policies

You can use a variety of commission calculations that apply to individual agents and products in different time periods.

Compact Policy History Timeline with Insurance History LWC

Configure the Insurance History Lightning web component (LWC) to display a timeline of policy activity in a single, chronological feed that's easy to scan and drill into.

Insurance Policy Transactions

Insurance Policy Commercial Lightning Web Component
Real-time Price Rerating

Tracking Earned and Unearned Revenue
Insurance Billing

You can use Insurance for revenue recognition for insurance policies. Revenue recognition tracks revenue per-policy as follows:
Insurance Policy Administration extends throughout the lifecycle of an insurance policy.

Any updates made to a policy during its term are managed through policy transactions.
The Actions Lightning Web Component (LWC) contains a Vlocity Card layout that displays actions used to perform common tasks.
A policy shows details about coverage, insured items, and insured parties.
title: Managing Insurance Policies in Salesforce
